details.purpose: Record the assessed risk of having or developing a condition due to prevalence in relatives.
details.use: For recording information about the prevalence of the condition in relatives and quantifying risk to the subject of care.
details.misuse: Not for recording problems of individual relatives - use 'openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem' and 'openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem-diagnosis' and set the subject of data to the relative.

items.items: The family members affected by the condition
Major morbidity with significant social impact
A clinical description of the affected relatives condition
A genetic relative of the data subject - not an adoptive relative
A ratio of the affected to non-affected relatives of a particular type
The proximity or line of the relatives
Relatives with 50% genetic share - parent, sibling, child
Relatives with 25% genetic share - grand parent, aunts and uncles, nieces and nephews, grand children
Relatives with 12.5% genetic share, great grand parents, great aunts and uncles, first cousins, children of neices and nephews, great grand children
The gender of the relatives included in the affected ratio
The number of relatives in this group unaffected by the index condition
A coded entry which is more specific than the index condition
The number affected by the index condition
Optional name of the person for future reference
Presence of condition in at least one related party
The age at which the condition was apparent
The age at which this relative died
The year or date of death
Index condition was cause of death
Indication that the index was a significant factor in the death of this relative
The severity of the condition for this relative
Evaluation to indicate that there is, or is not, a significant risk of this subject of care having, now or in the future, a condition.
Risk of condition based on family history
Evaluation to indicate that there is, or is not, a significant risk of this subject of care having, now or in the future, a condition due to prior occurrence in a family member.
The condition on which the risk assessment is focussed
The likelihood that this person will develop this condition or suffer in this way in the future
The degree of risk conferred on the subject by the presence of this condition amongst relatives
The person is not assessed at being at higher risk than the general population
The person may be of somewhat greater risk of developing the condition
The person is considered to be more likely to develop the condition than the general population
The person is considered to be likely to develop the condition
The means of calculating the risk
The relationship of the affected relative with the person of whom this is the family history
The relationship of this relative to the subject
